round_best: Develop a hybrid deep learning model that dynamically selects between Euclidean and non-Euclidean layers based on the data distribution's intrinsic geometry. This model would use an adaptive routing mechanism to decide, during training and inference, whether information should pass through Euclidean, SPD, Grassmann, spherical, or hyperbolic layers. This approach could potentially improve model performance on heterogeneous datasets containing a mix of linear and non-linear structures by optimizing the geometry of the data processing pathway.
